Job description

A opportunity exists for 2 x afternoon shift machine technician in our fast paced food manufacturing environment.

Key Responsibilities

  • Experience and knowledge in setting and dealing with TNA Baggers, cartoners, horizontal flow wrapping machines, robotic inner packers and shipper packers, palletizers, weighing machines, Klik Klok bagging machines and process automation
  • Identifying appropriate adjustments to machines
  • Troubleshoot production issues as required.


Mandatory Selection Criteria

  • Knowledge and experience in the food industry is a must
  • Forklift licence and be able to use a Reach Forklift is desirable.
  • Trouble shooting, fault finding and problem solving skills and quality adjustments.
  • Self - motivation and initiative


This position will give you the opportunity to work in a busy, fast paced food manufacturing environment, where you will have the chance to learn new skills in a versatile role. \xa0

If you think you have what it takes to fill this role, please apply below.

851289884:
[

Territory Manager (Pet & Vet)

Company Name Hill's Pet Nutrition Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 137 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Work that matters, fueled by passion for pets! At Hill’s we have a purpose. Every day around the world, we transform the lives of millions of pet families through pioneering innovation, amazing nutrition, and the best and brightest people. Founded more than 75 years ago with an unwavering commitment to pet nutrition, Hills' mission is to help enrich and lengthen the special relationships between people and their pets.

HILL'S\xae Prescription Diet\xae therapeutic pet foods, HILL'S\xae Science Diet\xae and HILL'S\xae Ideal Balance™ wellness pet foods are sold worldwide. Hill’s is a division of Colgate-Palmolive, a leading global consumer products company, tightly focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition, with sales of products in more than 200 countries. To learn more about Hill's and Colgate, please visit

Location: Melbourne, Victoria, Australia
No Relocation Assistance Offered
# 68973

Job Title: Territory Manager (Pet & Vet)
Function : Customer Development

Job Summary

Provide a direct interface with veterinary professionals at the practice level to ensure the highest levels of veterinary endorsement for Hill’s brands and with specialist pet retail operators at store level to ensure optimal execution of Hill’s 6Ps. Ensure Hill’s is the strategic partner of choice in the assigned stores and clinics and gain professional and business support to grow Share of Market and Sales.

Principal Duties And Responsibilities

%

Task

5%

Develop and maintain high standards of knowledge in small animal nutrition, Hill’s and competitors’ products through company training and self-study.

20%

Territory Management
  • Achieve territory sales targets
  • Plan and execute call value (coverage, frequency, productivity) for the territory, based on store/clinic classification and required activities.
  • Timely report calls and maintain records for the territory
  • Review store/clinic potential for the territory (every year)
  • Promptly identify new stores/clinics and secure strong presence and endorsement for Hill’s brands
  • Maintain accurate records in the Hill’s reporting system, e.g.
    • all stores/veterinary practices in the territory
    • all professional and administrative activities
60%

Business Development
  • Develop deep knowledge of the customers’ business and organization; build a network with key decision makers / key influencers in the store/vet practice. Maintain regular contacts with the HCT /store personnel and key influencers.
  • Provide best in class professional support (detailing, in-clinic/in-store seminars, technical meetings, trainings, merchandising), reaching all key stakeholders in specified practices/stores
  • Identify opportunities in the assigned stores/clinics and develop technical and business propositions that meet the needs of both Hill’s and the customer, resulting in BRMO leadership and superior 6P’s execution in clinic/store.
  • Implement commercial activities to ensure:
    • Awareness, full distribution and active endorsement by the veterinary profession of Hill’s products and services in all core disease categories.
    • Full distribution, excellent visibility and active endorsement by the store staff of Hill’s products.
    • Rapid acceptance, endorsement, support and distribution of new products
    • Establishment of shelf space, visibility and adequate inventory within each clinic and each store, as per Perfect Store standards
    • Establishment of merchandising and practice protocols to Hill’s Perfect Clinic standards
    • Increase recruitment of new users of Hill’s brands (e.g. trial programs)
    • Special secondary exhibition to maximize return of promotion campaigns
  • Develop and implement annual business plans for specified stores/veterinary clinics, which realise both the needs of customers and Hill’s overall commercial objectives.
  • Schedule regular (quarterly) business reviews with the decision maker in the store/clinic to assess the achievements versus the agreed goals and adjust plan accordingly

10%

Business & Financial management
  • Monitor the achievement of territory objectives versus target and develop corrective actions where necessary
  • Manage the assigned budget and ensure timely and accurate submission of POs to head office
  • Timely and accurate submission of T&E expenses
5%
  • Represent Hill’s at meetings/conferences e.g. Trade shows, Pet training days, Store Opening Day, Training days, Congress, Local and National meetings, Client Meetings and Practice Open Days
  • Keep abreast of trends in the speciality per industry/veterinary profession and of competitive activity and share this knowledge with the Head Office in the appropriate forums.

Education/ Experience Requirements
  • Bachelor Degree in Business, Pharmaceuticals, Veterinary Science or similar field is strongly recommended. MBA is a plus.
  • Previous sales experience in field sales, veterinary industry, FMCG, pharmaceutical company or Nutrition Company preferred.

Expected Areas Of Skills
  • Proficient computer skills in Microsoft Office, and ability to learn company specific tools & programs
  • Fluent in English
  • Valid driver’s license required

Leadership Competencies
  • Effective execution
  • Relationship Building
  • Consumer/Customer focused
  • Planning/Priority Setting
  • Influence / Negotiation
  • Teamwork and Collaboration

Functional Competencies
  • Understand Customers and Customer collaboration
  • In-Clinic/In-Store execution
  • Customer Influence and Negotiation
  • Integrated Commercial Planning

Key partnerships and reporting relationships
  • Does this position supervise: No
  • Reports to Field Sales Manager

Travel Requirements

Expected percentage of travel: Up to 90%

Are you interested in working for Hill's Pet Nutrition? You can apply to work with us using this online application. Attach all relevant documents such as a cover letter and resume or CV. Applications received by email are not considered in the selection process.

Become part of our team. We look forward to your application.

Equal Opportunity Employer
Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Industry

  • Logistics and Supply Chain
  • Retail

[

Paraplanner - Geelong

Company Name Crowe Horwath Australia Company Location Geelong

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 42 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Be part of an exciting growth phase
  • A high performing team and collaborative team culture
  • Extensive career progression opportunities and in-house learning and development program

About the company

Crowe Horwath in Australasia is a leading provider of accounting, audit, tax, business and financial advice to individuals as well as small and medium businesses.

Boasting a wide and strategically dispersed presence across Australia and New Zealand, Crowe Horwath together with parent company Findex, is committed to providing clients with the best quality outcomes through an intersection of relationships and technology, a holistic service offering, continuous evolution and a one best way process, which ensures we stay at the forefront of client expectations.

About the Role

As a Paraplanner, your role will involve supporting the company's Advisers, producing compliant Statements of Advice using Midwinter in a timely manner. This role will also see you making strategy and product recommendations, product comparisons, Insurance needs analysis, and provide alternative strategies.

As the company offers the full spectrum of financial services under the one roof, you will be partnering with our internal teams (including Compliance, Accounting and Audit, Investment and Product Services) to ensure the appropriateness of documentation, client strategies, fees, product recommendations, and delivery of documentation.

What we offer:

  • A structured career development pathway and the opportunity for personal and career growth within a diverse company;
  • Be a part of a business that is innovating how we deliver holistic financial advice to our clients’;
  • The opportunity to gain exposure to a broad range of financial strategies and financial professionals helping build your network and capabilities;
  • In-house learning and development including a structured Employee Development program;
  • A high performing team and collaborative team culture;
  • Competitive remuneration package and additional employee benefits.

To be considered

  • 1 + years’ experience in paraplanning
  • DFP qualified\xa0
  • Experience on all types of advice and a variety of products
  • Financial services industry experience and knowledge
  • High quality communication skills and professional presentation
  • Passion for advice quality, accuracy and timeliness

If you are interested in joining our fast growing company and your skills meet the above criteria please submit your cover letter and resume by clicking 'Apply' at the top of the page.

Please note that only successful applicants will be contacted.

Industry

  • Insurance

Employment Type

New Business Sales Executive

Company Name Simtail Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 109 views

Job description

Do you hate being behind a desk all day? Then this is the role for you!

This is a self starting role, you must without a doubt be:

  • Determined
  • Professional
  • Confident
  • Patient
  • Ability to think on your feet
  • Understand marketing
  • A problem solver
  • A strong communicator


A typical day:

  • Ensure your day is filled with appointments
  • Source new leads
  • Attend networking functions to represent the brand
  • Administration of proposals for distribution


This is a job that is not for the faint hearted. It is for someone that does not want to sit behind a desk all day and understands marketing. They must be energetic and love getting out to meet new people to learn about their business.


We are looking for someone that is determined to hit sales targets, is able to forward think and is able to set a strong plan in motion. You must have the enthusiasm to meet new businesses and want to help build their success.\xa0


A existing network of small businesses will assist in getting moving in this role!\xa0


An understanding of marketing is also important to be able to create and identify marketing opportunities for potential clients.\xa0


Simtail is a company working across Australia. With an app about to hit the market, this is a role for a real go getter that is strong, extremely driven and can problem solve to improve and reach their sales targets.


Once proven in this role, the position will be responsible for mentoring other states to achieve sales targets.


Our first to market platform opens up marketing opportunities to all types and levels of business.


We want to spread and ensure that all businesses have the opportunity and access to marketing tools. We truly want to assist businesses to achieve their full potential, either as a paying client or as a connection of Simtail.


Large incentives and bonuses are available for the right candidate. The role has a base wage and quarterly commissions.\xa0


Training

  • Full platform training is provided
  • Full marketing suite is provided
  • Interstate travel may be required\xa0


If you want to make a difference and become part of a company that is growing into a global platform, then apply today!

Instructional Designer

Company Name Estia Health Company Location Ground Floor, 357 Camberwell Road , Camberwell, VIC 3124, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 118 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

As an ASX200 listed company in Australia's fastest growing industry, Estia Health is dedicated to caring for thousands of older Australians who choose to make Estia their home. As we continue to expand, we are striving to attract, develop and retain the best talent in Aged Care. With over 7500 employees in both metropolitan and regional Australia, we are proud to be a values based organisation providing meaningful careers.

\xa0

About the role

Estia Health are looking for an experienced Instructional Designer to join the Learning & Development team within People and Culture. This role will help Estia deliver engaging training programs that make a difference to the quality of care provided in our homes. This person will be able to immediately make a difference with their creative flair, strong project management skills and instructional design expertise. Join our team with a focus on delivering a positive user experience for staff and managers.

\xa0

About you

You’ll bring to the role your energy, your passionate and caring nature and you will have:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Vocational/Adult Learning, Instructional Design or a related field
  • Demonstrated experience in the end-to-end content development cycle and related software (including SCORM development - Lectora experience highly regarded)
  • Demonstrated experience in administering and maintaining Learning Management Systems (Moodle/Totara experience highly regarded)
  • Demonstrated experience in SharePoint highly regarded
  • Demonstrated high-level communication (both written and verbal), influencing and interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrated planning and goal setting capability
  • A minimum of 3 years' experience in a similar or related role
  • Knowledge of Work Health and Safety and a commitment to keeping yourself and others safe and well


What we will do for you

At Estia Health, we love to see our team members grow with us. We encourage you to develop your skill and capability and have a range of structured clinical and professional development programs to help you grow your career.

\xa0

Join us!

If you would like to know more, please call our recruitment team on 1300 615 724 or by emailing recruitment@estiahealth.com.au.\xa0


To find out more about Estia Health and the wonderful work we do, please visit and follow our LinkedIn page.

Job description

Territory Manager - Spine - Victoria

  • Are you self-motivated, resilient and driven by results?
  • Use your experience to become a spinal sales expert!
  • Do you have what it takes?


THE COMPANY

  • This company is recognised globally and is known as a leader in spinal surgery and innovation. An organisation that devotes itself to improving patient outcomes and surgical techniques by producing and bringing to market the best technology and products.
  • Established themselves as a perennial innovator and continued leader through their high level of innovation and enviable surgeon and staff training.


THE OPPORTUNITY
  • An incredible chance to join a motivated team and organisation. The opportunity is Melbourne based and focused on selling the best surgical implants and supporting minimally invasive procedures. \xa0
  • Support hospital, operating theatre and private clinic staff, whilst working closely with some of the best neuro, spine and orthopaedic surgeons and surgical staff across Victoria.


THE BENEFITS
  • Earn a competitive base and lucrative commissions with ample opportunity to overachieve
  • Market-leading training and development program (local and overseas)
  • Join a successful and passionate team
  • ‘Total Spine solution sales’ – Sell implants, instruments, navigation, imaging and latest technology in Spine


YOU WILL NEED
  • Experience in Hospital Sales in the medical device industry, preferably with theatre and orthopaedics exposure
  • Self-motivated, resilient and driven by results… Do you have what it takes?
  • Proven track record of exceptional sales achievements and an ability to win business born from an appetite and motivation to be successful
  • You need to be a people person, a gifted communicator and talented relationship builder who leaves lasting and positive impressions.
